definitions_glossary.planck_energy: The fundamental energy scale √(ℏc⁵/G) ≈ 1.96 × 10⁹ J ≈ 1.22 × 10¹⁹ GeV where quantum gravity effects dominate
definitions_glossary.quantum_corrections: Higher-order terms in perturbation theory that become comparable to leading terms at Planck energy
definitions_glossary.unification_energy: Energy scale where all fundamental forces merge into a single interaction
definitions_glossary.gut_scale: Grand Unification scale ~10¹⁶ GeV where strong, weak, and electromagnetic forces unify (below Planck scale)
definitions_glossary.string_scale: Characteristic energy scale in string theory, typically near Planck energy
definitions_glossary.energy_density: Energy per unit volume, critical quantity in cosmology and black hole physics
definitions_glossary.lhc_energy: Large Hadron Collider collision energy ~10⁴ GeV, 15 orders below Planck energy

key_relationships.description: Einstein mass-energy equivalence applied to Planck mass

key_relationships.relation: ΔE·Δt ≥ ℏ/2 at Planck scale gives ΔE ~ Eₚ for Δt ~ tₚ

scale_comparisons.description: LHC reaches 10⁴ GeV, 15 orders of magnitude below Planck energy

Higgs mass at ~125 GeV represents hierarchy problem
Energy content of 40 liters of gasoline

definition.@value: The fundamental energy scale √(ℏc⁵/G) ≈ 1.22 × 10¹⁹ GeV where quantum gravity effects dominate and all fundamental forces are expected to unify

scopeNote.@value: Critical for particle physics, cosmology, string theory, grand unification theories, and understanding energy limits of physical theories

learning_objectives: Define Planck energy and understand its relationship to Planck mass
Explain why Planck energy represents the quantum gravity scale
Understand the energy hierarchy from electroweak to GUT to Planck scales
Recognize implications for particle physics unification theories
Appreciate the experimental inaccessibility of Planck energy scales
common_errors: Thinking Planck energy might be reachable by particle accelerators (15 orders short)
Confusing Planck energy with GUT scale energy (GUT is 10³ times lower)
Not appreciating the hierarchy problem: why is electroweak scale so far below Planck?
physics_insights: Eₚ sets the scale where α_G ~ 1, making gravity 'strong' like other forces
String theory predicts fundamental strings have tension ~Eₚ²
Black hole formation prevents probing sub-Planckian distances with higher energies
Early universe at t ~ tₚ had temperature Tₚ and energy density ~Eₚ/ℓₚ³
Hierarchy problem: Why is m_Higgs² ~(10² GeV)² not renormalized up to ~(10¹⁹ GeV)²?
